page.title: 15EVERTHORPE VILLAGE
page.content: Everthorpe is a small village. We walked from school to Everthorpe. We went along a public footpath across some fields to get there. We counted six farms as we walked around the village and about forty six houses. There was one market garden. Some of the farms had cattle but most of them were arable farming. The only amenities we could find were a telephone kiosk with a post box attached to it. We walked back to school along Shaw Lane and Ferry Road. We walked by The Youth Custody Centre and The Telephone Exchange. We were now back in South Cave.
